message.content:
cs.DM, cs.FL, cs.LO, cs.IT, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with the study of synchronizing word lengths in automata theory, which is a topic that falls under the category of Discrete Mathematics (cs.DM). The paper also involves the analysis of partial automata (PFAs), which is a subfield of Formal Languages and Automata Theory (cs.FL). The use of string rewriting and the construction of PFAs with exponential shortest synchronizing word length suggests that the paper may also belong to the category of Information Theory (cs.IT). The study of lower bounds and maximal possible lengths in automata theory is closely related to the field of Logic in Computer Science (cs.LO). Finally, the paper's focus on synchronization and transitivity in automata suggests that it may also belong to the category of Systems and Control (cs.SY).
